mixed-citation.article-title: Revision of the genus Miridiba Reitter, 1902 (Coleoptera, Scarabaeidae, Melolonthinae): genital morphotypes and new taxonomic data

Miridiba taipei Wang & Li
in
Li et al ., 2015: 530
( type loc.: Taipei , Taiwan , China ).

Miridiba taipei
–
Bezděk 2016: 272
(catalogue). —
Gao et al . 2018: 16
(catalogue); 2019: 461 (species list; in key).

Miridiba taipei
was described based on a male holotype and seven type specimens ( six males and one female ) (
Li et al . 2015
). According to the original description,
M. taipei
can be separated from the similar species
M. trichophora
and
M. hirsuta
by having three distinctive morphological characters at the apex of clypeus, anterior margin of pronotum and parameres. We were unable to examine the types of
M. taipei
but, according to the 9-segmented antenna and shape of parameres, this species is included in this genital morphotype I “
Trichophora
”.
